page.title: 01The Ascrib Islands
page.content: South Ascrib is the main island in a group lying in Loch Snizort between Uig and Waternish. Bare, treeless, uninhabited, they are a home for seals and seabirds, puffins, guillemots, kittiwakes, razorbills, common gulls, black-backs and crows. Eider ducks breed there. The only sign of human habitation is the ruin of a shooting- box built of the local stone which is basalt. There is no landing-place. Boats have to stand off while a small boat brings passengers to a scrambling- place on the rocks. The vegetation is mainly rank grass and heather with bracken, thrift and scurry-grass - all th commoner types of cliff-top vegetation. There is grazing for a few sheep.
